citation.article-title: Re-evaluation of the status of the genus Oerskovia, reclassification of Promicromonospora enterophila (Jager et al. 1983) as Oerskovia enterophila comb. nov. and description of Oerskovia jenensis sp. nov. and Oerskovia paurometabola sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Oerskovia paurometabola sp. nov.
Oerskovia paurometabola (pau.ro.me.ta'bo.la. Gr. adj. paurus little ; Gr. adj. metabolus changeable; N.L. fem. adj. paurometabola producing little change)
Gram-positive, not acid-fast, facultatively anaerobic organism with branching vegetative hyphae.
On trypticase/soy/yeast extract agar (medium 92, DSMZ Catalogue of Strains), colonies are cream-yellow, 0.5-0.6 mm in diameter at 28 °C after 2 days.
Substrate hyphae fragment into non-motile bacillary and coccoid or spore-like elements.
Water-soluble diffusible pigments and melanins are not produced.
Glucose is metabolized both oxidatively and facultatively fermentatively.
Positive and negative reactions are listed in Tables 4 and 5.
Peptidoglycan is of the A4α type, variation L-Lys←L-Thr←D-Glu.
Isolated from soil, leafy wood, Carpathian Mountains.
